help_wifi_security.lang_hws1: Note: After you have made your changes, click Save Settings to apply your changes.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws4: The 5 GHz and 2.4 GHz networks can use different security options. Select the security option for each wireless network.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws5: Note: This list ranks the encryption options.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws7: WPA2/WPA Mixed Mode – WPA2: Strongest; WPA: Strong
help_wifi_security.lang_hws10: WPA2/WPA Mixed Mode / WPA2 Personal / WPA Personal
help_wifi_security.lang_hws13: WPA2/WPA Enterprise Mixed Mode / WPA2 Enterprise / WPA Enterprise
help_wifi_security.lang_hws14: These options should only be used when a RADIUS server is connected to the Router.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws16: Enter the IP address of the RADIUS server.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws18: Enter the port number of the RADIUS server. The default is 1812.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws20: Enter the key shared between the Router and the server.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws22: WEP is a basic encryption method, which is not as secure as WPA.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws24: Select a level of WEP encryption.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws26: Enter a passphrase to automatically generate WEP keys. Then click Generate.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws28: If you did not enter a passphrase, enter the WEP key(s) manually.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws30: This option should only be used when a RADIUS server is connected to the Router.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws32: Enter the IP address of the RADIUS server.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws34: Enter the port number of the RADIUS server. The default is 1812.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws36: Enter the key shared between the Router and the server.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws38: Select a level of WEP encryption.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws40: Enter a passphrase to automatically generate WEP keys. Then click Generate.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws42: If you did not enter a passphrase, enter the WEP key(s) manually.
help_wifi_security.lang_hws43: Note: For more information, refer to the online User Guide at www.linksys.com.
